alert.note: Alert for Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:12PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Nicholas and central Webster Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 710 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Craigsville, or 9 miles northeast of Summersville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Webster Springs, Addison (Webster Springs), Camden-On-gauley, Birch River, Craigsville, Camden On Gauley, Cowen, Diana, Canvas, Muddlety, Upper Glade, Boggs, Calvin and Erbacon. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 43 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster
